metadata.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Via DLL
metadata.comment: Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll. This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\installutil.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\regasm.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\regsvcs.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\regsvr32.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\rundll32.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('installutil\\.exe', 'regasm\\.exe', 'regsvcs\\.exe', 'regsvr32\\.exe', 'rundll32\\.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('default.getstring')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('downloadstring')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('frombase64string')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('icm ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iex ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('invoke-command')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('invoke-expression'))))

output.summary: Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll. This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.
